intro: Ouratea tristis, commonly known as the Florida holly or Florida waxmyrtle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
